Posts.Content: I am through 2 of 4 taxotere/cytoxan treatments and I do have hip pain as well as bone pain in other areas. My onco said bone pain can be a side effect of the taxotere, although it's not a common side effect. Guess we are just the lucky ones! lol Good luck!
Posts.Title: Painful hips and legs at night?

Posts.Content: I have one more chemo to go on Aug. 24. I am 61 and a resource teacher three days a week. Staff development begins Aug. 26 (won't make that) and classes on Aug.30! I seem to be more tired with each chemo treatment and my dilemma is I have radiation to face in mid Sept. I understand from some people that chemo exacerbates the fatigue from radiation and I'm wondering whether to try to return to work or just go on a TDI for a couple of months which would allow for a steady sub to take my place and not be disruptive to my students.Of course my doctors say that everyone is different and it is hard to predict. Any advice?
Posts.Title: Worried about returning to work

Posts.Content: I have completed 4 of 6 weeks of radiation and am noticing some change in the way things taste. Has anyone else had this happen?
Posts.Title: radiation and taste
